jobs.title: Senior Travel Planning Specialist for Custom & Group Tours
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Our client, a fast-growing travel and tourism startup, is hiring a Travel Planning Specialist for Custom & Group Tours to work with our clients to create unique, tailor-made itineraries and custom quotes. We are looking for candidates who are passionate about travel, like to problem-solve, and genuinely enjoy researching and finding solutions for clients.


Our client connects people with the best tours and activities around the world, while providing industry-leading service and support. As a member of our Custom and Groups team, you will be responsible for designing, quoting, selling, and executing excursions for our travel advisors all around the world.

Responsibilites

  • Communicate with clients via email and phone using our internal ticket syste

  • Impress travel advisors with prompt, professional, and friendly service.

  • Collaborate daily with tour operators worldwide (in English) to design custom and group itineraries.

  • Create bespoke proposals and quotes tailored to each group leader’s specifications.

  • Manage requests ranging from single custom tours to multi-day group itineraries, including troubleshooting real-time issues.

  • Proactively suggest creative ideas and unique experiences to enhance the client’s journey.

  • Request, build, and maintain tour content, pricing, and logistics for group shore excursions and land-based custom programs.

  • Coordinate group tour capacities, schedules, and operational details with tour operators.

  • Update operators and travel advisors on itinerary changes, schedule revisions, or availability updates.

  • Assist travel advisors and group leaders with questions, concerns, and booking support.

  • Monitor penalty schedules, vendor agreements, cost confirmations, and operational deadlines for groups.

  • Review guest feedback on custom and group programs and share actionable insights with vendors and partners.

  • If you thrive in a fast-paced environment and get excited about curating memorable travel experiences for groups and special requests, this role offers the perfect blend of creativity, problem-solving, and customer interaction.

The Ideal Candidate

  • Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, power point.

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

  • Ability to multi-task, prioritize and problem solve in a fast past environment.

  • Ability to manage changing priorities and meet deadlines

  • Strong interpersonal and customer service skills.

  • Strong analytical capabilities with a high level of attention to detail

  • Works well independently and as part of a team

  • Is fluent in written and spoken English (Other languages desirable)

Benefits Include:

·      Company Healthcare plan

·      401K

·      Enrollment in company phantom equity plan

·      Paid PTO

·      Employee discounts on thousands of tours and activities


This position is great for someone who thrives without a lot of structure, works independently, responds well to change and a fluid working environment, and who always tries to find a better way of doing things.

jobs.title: Technical Account Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
The Opportunity

Our client is seeking a Technical Account Manager to help with the integration and growth of several enterprise distribution partnerships. You’ll be responsible for guiding partners to go-live, then driving growth and expansion in tandem with the Account Owner. Alongside your TAM responsibilities (roughly 85% TAM / 15% BI), you’ll use MySQL and Tableau to define and publish partner KPIs, perform ad-hoc analyses, and collaborate with the team to produce data visualizations and reports that drive the team’s success.

What You’ll Do

Technical Account Management (≈85%)

  • Your primary responsibility will be providing technical expertise and support for our wholesale distribution partners. Secondary responsibilities will include: supporting our Agency Sales Team with onboarding new clients and API integrations, and supporting our Supply Team with technical expertise for supplier API connections.

  • Lead end-to-end onboarding: discovery, solution design, mapping, UAT, go-live, hypercare.

  • Act as Project Expedition’s API subject matter expert (REST/JSON, auth, pagination, rate limits, idempotency, webhooks, versioning).

  • Support and debug integrations: trace booking/availability issues, reconcile data, and produce partner-ready findings.

  • Drive adoption & growth and contribute to joint roadmaps. Support Sales with developing unique technical solutions when API integrations are not possible.

  • Understand our supply-side APIs that connect us with tour operators so you can support internal teams and help debug issues that impact our enterprise partners.

BI / Data Analytics (≈15%)

  • Provide data analytics and business intelligence support to other departments. This includes building reports, dashboards, and helping to leverage data to drive important decisions.

  • Efficiently build Tableau dashboards and develop data sources.

  • Write efficient MySQL queries to power analyses and Tableau extracts, and support adjacent teams with data needs.

  • Light warehouse work as needed (reading from Snowflake/other sources), plus basic governance (permissions, RLS coordination, documentation).

What You’ll Bring (Required)

  • 5+ years in a TAM/Partner Engineer/Solutions Engineer role for an API-driven product (travel/marketplace/SaaS ideal).

  • Proficiency in account management, and client facing communication.

  • Strong MySQL proficiency: complex joins, aggregations, query tuning/EXPLAIN, data validation/reconciliation, and building query-backed Tableau extracts.

  • Hands-on with REST/JSON, API auth (keys/OAuth/HMAC), webhooks, retries, idempotency, versioning, and pagination.

  • Pro at debugging with Postman/cURL and reading logs; clear written/verbal communication and partner-facing documentation.

  • Tableau experience (calcs, parameters, LODs, actions, extract vs live, publishing/permissions).

  • An ability to work effectively across departments (Sales, Account Management, Support and Operations)

  • Strong attention to detail, and an ability to work well independently.

  • Fluency in spoken and written English.

  • A professional and appropriate appearance for business engagements, including any in-person or virtual client meetings, calls, or events.

  • Exceptional problem solving skills and the ability to manage projects effectively.

Nice to Have (Preferred, Not Required)

  • Familiarity with Snowflake or another cloud warehouse (read/query competence).

  • Exposure to dbt and ELT tools (Fivetran/Airbyte) for collaborating with data engineers.

  • BI ops & governance basics (semantic layers, RLS patterns) and observability (Datadog/Sentry).

  • Light scripting (Python/JS) for one-off utilities.

#LI-MW1

jobs.descriptionHtml:
Client Experience –Sr. Manager (People Operations/HR)


Location: Remote (see list of approved locations) 

Type: Full-Time 

Compensation: $72,800 - $113,750


The position can be in any of our office markets/states (FL, CO, IL, MA, NH, RI, ME, CT, GA, SC, NC) 


Who We Are... Let us introduce ourselves.  

livingHR is the remote-first, professional services “work agency” created to make work better. We have served over 400+ organizations to provide human-centric, future-of-work ready, HR-managed services, professional services, and products to augment HR and People functions around the world.   


livingHR believes in taking exceptional care of our team so they can take exceptional care of our clients, partners, and communities. We are adaptable, entrepreneurial, and always looking to iterate and make improvements, which can come with a lot of change (for the better). If you are looking for a role where no day is ever the same, and you prescribe to the idea that variety is the spice of life, then you will likely enjoy our way of working. The people who find the most success here are those who are willing to be a part of a team, where no task is too big or too small, and feedback is welcomed.  


To learn more about our Culture Code, Cares Campaign, and our WeBelong work in Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion visit our website: https://livinghr.com/.   


As a full-time team member, we offer you:   

Autonomy & Flexibility: We call it, WfWiMS “Work from Where it Makes Sense,” a philosophy we have had in play since our inception in 2009, and we have no plans to change. This flexibility comes with a responsibility to self-manage and be an exceptional performer. We work remotely and have offices in our hub markets if you want to come in or go onsite with a client and from time to time, we do that too.  

Compensation: Competitive, fair, and transparent base salary plus incentives for account growth, retention, and client referrals.  

Comprehensive Benefits: We provide a wide range of benefits, including medical, dental, 401k, STD/LTD, life, and telehealth mental health counseling. 

Flexible PTO/Paid Holidays: We encourage you to use your time, with a minimum requirement, and provide *23 paid holidays.  

A Culture of Impact and Humanity: We care about the impact we make and the humanity we extend to each other, our clients, and our broader community. Learn more about the culture here: https://livinghr.com/culture.

Responsibilities

  • Support the development of modernized people solutions for HR/People teams and their employees in all aspects of HR/People Operations to improve workplace experiences. 

  • Use human-centric design thinking approach to build client deliverables and provide exceptional client employee experiences. 

  • Work on project deliverables in livingHR’s practice areas: Org Design and Workforce Planning, People Operations and Core HR, HR Tech Selection and Implementation, Total Rewards and Compensation, Strategy (M&A, Business Strategy, People Strategy), Performance Management / Learning and Development, DEIB. 

  • Support client engagements with a focus on delivery excellence, strategic alignment, and profitability. 

  • Positively impact client satisfaction and retention through exceptional service delivery and achievement of KPIs (e.g., NPS, client retention, referrals, account growth). 

  • Partner with the Principal to build and maintain strong client relationships, delivering strategic insights that influence clients’ KPIs (e.g., eNPS, turnover, time to fill) and identifying client growth opportunities. 

  • Serve as a trusted advisor from initial engagement to ongoing client evolution, demonstrating livingHR’s value as a long-term partner. 

  • Apply project management skills to ensure accurate reporting, effective communication, and successful project outcomes. 

  • Track billable work and maintain project management software and CRM data. 

  • Align HR strategies with clients’ broader business objectives through a combination of strategic thinking and hands-on operational expertise. 

  • Participate in highly collaborative project teams to deliver support and deliverables to clients in alignment with livingHR’s standards for productivity, utilization, and client impact. 

  • Partner with project teams to deliver strategic insights through QBRs and executive summaries to provide recommendations to clients to enhance the employee experience and business outcomes.  

  • Optimize HR processes, policies, and systems to enhance efficiency, compliance, and employee experience. 

  • Implement core HR practices, including onboarding, employee relations, and policy development. 

  • Advise on compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations. 

  • Analyze organizational structure, roles, and capabilities to align with strategic goals. 

  • Design and implement workforce plans that address skills gaps, succession, and growth needs. 

  • Facilitate workforce planning workshops with leadership to identify and prioritize talent strategies. 

  • Lead human capital due diligence, integration planning, and post-close execution in M&A. 

  • Develop people strategies that align talent, culture, and structure with business objectives. 

  • Provide strategic advisory on organizational transformation, growth, and change management. 

As a Sr. Manager, you will also...

  • Serve as the primary client contact for engagement delivery. 

  • Lead multiple projects simultaneously, ensuring scope, budget, and quality standards are met. 

  • Provide strategic insights and recommendations to enhance client business outcomes. 

  • Mentor Managers, Sr. Associates, and Associates. 

Role Requirements

  • Strong preference for experience working directly with clients in professional services, PEOs, or recruiting agencies. 

  • Internal HR generalist experience required across multiple disciplines (e.g., talent acquisition, employee relations, total rewards, workforce planning). 

  • Commitment to flexible, high-performance ways of working in exchange for exceptional performance. 

  • Self-motivated, adaptable, and able to thrive in a fast-paced, client-facing environment. 

  • Exceptional organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple client accounts and projects simultaneously. 

  • Strong communication, consulting, and relationship management skills. 

  • Willingness to travel as needed (minimal travel required). 

  • Preferred certifications include HR credentials (PHR, SPHR, SHRM-CP, SHRM-SCP) and HR tech platform certifications (Workday, SuccessFactors, Oracle HCM, etc.). 

  • 7–9 years of progressive HR, consulting, or professional services experience.  

  • Proven track record of leading client engagements and mentoring junior team members.  

  • Bachelor’s degree required; Master’s or advanced certification (SPHR, SHRM-SCP) preferred. 

This role is primarily performed in a remote or office setting and requires the ability to:

  • Work at a computer for extended periods 

  • Communicate clearly and effectively through digital platforms 

  • Participate regularly in video meetings with camera on 

  • Travel occasionally to client sites and work onsite, which may involve standing, walking, or facilitating in-person meetings 

  • Occasional light lifting of materials up to 10 pounds may be required. Reasonable accommodations will be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the role 

What You Can Expect 

While we wish we could personally respond to every candidate, we will only reach out to candidates that meet or exceed the requirements and align with where livingHR has hub offices (https://livinghr.com/locations).  


Resources + staying connected 

We have also built a career transition portal to help everyone in their search for their next role. Check it out: https://livinghr.com/career-transition-portal  


Follow us on social: https://www.linkedin.com/company/livinghr/ | https://www.instagram.com/livinghrinc | https://www.facebook.com/livinghrinc/   


Check out our Careers page for additional opportunities: https://livinghr.com/careers   


If you need assistance or any accommodations with this application, we’re here and so happy to help. Contact us at talent@livinghr.com.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
Join our client, an AmLaw 100, as the Chief Financial Officer (CFO), a strategic member of the

Firm’s Senior Leadership Team, responsible for the integrity of all financial information and

systems, and for directing the firm’s overall financial policies. The CFO oversees key

administrative and operational areas including Revenue Cycle Management, Core Accounting

Functions, Financial Reporting and Analysis, Partner Accounting and Taxation, Procurement,

Insurance, and Workplace Strategies. The CFO reports to the Chief Executive and communicates

broadly across the firm, fostering a culture of excellent customer service, efficiency, and

collaboration.

Financial Leadership & Strategy

  • Ensure the integrity and security of the firm’s financial information and systems. 

  • Develop and execute financial strategies aligned with the firm’s goals for growth, profitability, and sustainability. 

  • Direct the firm’s overall financial policies and ensure standardized fiscal management policies and procedures are in place and followed. 

  • Prepare financial analyses regarding the implications of firm actions such as mergers, lateral acquisitions, and capital expenditures. 

Financial Operations & Reporting

  • Oversee all financial functions including accounting, budgeting, credit, insurance, tax, office leases and buildout costs, and treasury. 

  • Ensure timely and accurate financial reporting, including dashboards and management reports. 

  • Manage the firm’s accounting systems, including time and cost inventory, billing, collections, accounts receivable, accounts payable, general ledger, fixed assets, and profit models. 

  • Lead budgeting, forecasting, and financial reporting processes; provide actionable insights to firm leadership. 

Profitability & Benchmarking

  • Analyze firm profitability at the matter, client, attorney, practice, and SBU levels; provide recommendations for profit improvement. 

  • Analyze best practice ratios and statistics, compare results to both internal and industry benchmarks, and recommend improvements. 

  • Provide analytical services for Senior Leadership Team members to ensure profit objectives are achieved. 

Cash Management & Compliance

  • Manage cash flow, banking relationships, and partner compensation/distributions. 

  • Maintain the firm’s banking relationships and supervise all cash management functions. 

  • Ensure compliance with tax laws, partnership agreements, and regulatory requirements. 

  • Perform routine audits of financial information and equipment to secure the firm’s assets. 

Partner & Compensation Accounting

  • Assist in the partner compensation process and provide detailed account analysis of all partner compensation and capital accounts. 

  • Provide guidance on non-partner timekeeper compensation and set performance expectations.


Procurement & Insurance

  • Oversee the firm’s centralized procurement operations and policies. 

  • Evaluate, procure, and manage select firm insurance policies (e.g., professional liability, property & casualty, cyber, health, workers’ compensation). 

  • Regularly assess the firm’s risk profile, recommend appropriate insurance coverage, and risk mitigation strategies. 

  • Oversee claims management and coordinate with brokers, carriers, and legal counsel as needed. 

Workplace Strategies & Facilities

  • Oversee office facilities management, including lease negotiations, space utilization, buildout costs, and vendor relationships. 

  • Develop and implement workplace strategies that support productivity, collaboration, and employee well-being. 

  • Collaborate with HR, IT, and other administrative departments to ensure workplace policies and tools meet the evolving needs of attorneys and staff. 

Leadership & Collaboration

  • Lead, mentor, and develop the finance, facilities, and insurance administration teams. 

  • Communicate widely and often with all members of the firm to foster excellent customer service, efficiency, and collaboration. 

  • Respond with a sense of urgency to support attorneys in serving client relationships. 

Other Responsibilities

  • Perform other duties as assigned by the Chief Executive or Executive Leadership Team.

Physical Requirements

  • The employee may be required to be stationary for prolonged periods, open filing cabinets and bend or stand as necessary, be able to inspect and observe information on a computer screen at least 80% of the time, and, on occasion, have the ability to lift or carry 25-30 pounds. 

  • The above is intended to describe the general content of and requirements for the performance of this job. It is not to be construed as an exhaustive statement of essential functions, responsibilities, or requirements. The Firm will provide reasonable accommodation as necessary to allow an individual with a disability to apply for and/or perform the essential functions of a position.If you need assistance to accommodate a disability, please contact HR. 

Core Requirements

  • Ability to deliver superior service to all internal and external customers and communicate effectively. 

  • Ability to always interact in a professional and courteous manner with clients and employees; professional appearance required. 

  • Ability to successfully perform position requirements with excellent organizational, time-management and prioritization skills required. 

  • Ability to work collaboratively within a team; ability and willingness to adapt to changing business demands. 

  • Ability to produce acceptable amounts of work efficiently and accurately; ability to produce quality final work product. 

  • Ability to always exercise good judgment by making sound and practical decisions; ability to assume responsibility for decisions and act decisively under deadlines. 

  • Elevated level of professional integrity required; ability to maintain confidentiality and build trust.  

  • Ability to lead and motivate others; when applicable, ability to successfully manage direct report(s), including performance evaluation, goal setting, employee development and problem-solving. 

Position Requirements

  • Master of Business Administration (MBA) degree required. 

  • Minimum of 5 years of law firm CFO experience required, at an AmLaw100 firm. 

  • Minimum of 15 years’ progressive expertise in related areas required; substantial experience leading company-wide initiatives within a multi-office setting, preferably in a professional services firm environment required. 

  • Significant mastery of complex concepts, practices, and procedures within Finance field. 

  • Must be able to travel extensively.

Join an independent wealth management company built on relationships, not transactions with a mission to help individuals and families preserve and grow their wealth with integrity, transparency, and a deeply personal touch.  Clients are served across Southwest Florida and beyond, offering investment management, trust, and estate services with a boutique feel and institutional strength.   • Serve as the welcoming face of the office—greet visitors and clients with warmth and professionalism.

  • Provide general information and respond to basic inquiries. 

  • Manage incoming and outgoing mail and deliveries.

  • Schedule and manage meeting rooms and shared spaces.

  • Proven experience as a receptionist, administrative assistant or similar. 

  • Excellent communication skills with a natural sense of hospitality and professionalism. 

  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail. 

  • Adaptable to last minute changes with a high sense of urgency.

Nice-to-Haves

  • Experience in a professional or financial services environment.

jobs.title: Vice President Talent Management
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Vice President of Talent Management

The Vice President of Talent Management will report to the CHRO and is responsible and accountable for designing and overseeing the strategic development and implementation of all talent management and learning initiatives, including employee coaching and training, leadership development programs, career progression pathways, and performance management systems with the goal of developing and retaining high-performing employees aligned with the client's values, its strategic objectives, and its mission to ensure a culture of continuous learning, improvement, and growth.

Client Values

  • Ensure the strategic development, alignment and integration of the organization’s values as a foundation to the organization’s overall strategic initiatives.

  • Ensure integration into the organization’s recruitment, orientation, on-boarding, learning and development, performance management, leadership assessment and succession planning processes.

Strategic Talent Management

  • Develop and execute a comprehensive talent management strategy to identify, develop, and retain top talent across the organization.

  • Conduct workforce analyses to identify current and future skills needs, aligning talent development initiatives with strategic business goals.

  • Design and implement succession planning processes to ensure critical roles are adequately staffed and talent identified for future needs.

Leadership Development

  • Develop leadership programs for emerging leaders through executive leadership in the areas of business knowledge, continuous improvement, as well as team, organizational and industry leadership.

  • Develop and deploy Management-in-Training programs for core areas in the organization that anticipate high growth.

  • Develop, brand and oversee client’s leadership development program

Performance Management

  • Establish a robust performance management system to measure employee performance, provide regular feedback, and areas of continuous improvement.

  • Coach and mentor leaders to enhance their leadership capabilities.

Global Education

  • Develop global unified new-hire orientation programs for manufacturing, distribution, transportation, retail and professional positions.

  • Assess, design and develop job specific training for all positions within the organization.

  • Establish continual education for all employees and build a learning library that supports all leaders in the organization in working on the development of their people and teams.

  • Analyze and develop supervisory education for all emerging supervision within the organization.

  • Oversee the organization’s tuition reimbursement program.

Technical Education

  • Work in conjunction with engineering, merchandising, marketing, design, HR, IT and Finance in the development of advanced certification programs for key technical positions.

  • Learning Management Systems – Provide centralized oversight, including regulation documentation and auditing.

  • ELearning and Instructional Approach – Provide centralized oversight, including approaches to eLearning design and development, content object management, style guide best practices and staying abreast of development for multiple operating systems and platforms (ie; mobile, tablet).

Additional Responsibilities:

  • Make employment decisions and/or recommendations on hiring, improvement plans, transfers, promotions, corrective actions, terminations, pay adjustments, etc.

  • Coordinate and manage the work of employees by directing members of the team to meet the area’s goals.

  • Audit regularly to ensure standard operating procedures are being adhered to.

  • Manage employee performance and assist employees in making improvements to their performance through coaching, mentoring and administering performance reviews.

  • Recommend, plan and/or implement employee training and skill development activities.

  • Audit, maintain and ensure employee time-keeping and absentee records are accurate.

  • Communicate company and departmental issues and goals and facilitate employee growth and development through weekly team meetings, regular individual employee meetings, coaching, training, and company-offered learning opportunities.

  • Manage resources to optimize equipment, facilities, employees, methods and materials.

  • Demonstrate the company’s values in the performance of all job functions.

Education:

  • Undergraduate Degree, Required

  • Graduate Degree, Desired

  • Bachelor’s or Graduate Degree in Organization Development or related field preferred

Experience:

  • 15 years of proven experience successfully leading talent management, leadership development, and training program design and implementation

  • Experience creating and designing L&D content for a manufacturing organization

  • Large, multi-function as well as cross geographic organizations

  • Human Performance Improvement and associated Learning and Development practices

Licenses or Certifications:

  • Certified Training Facilitator or Coach, preferred

  • Six Sigma, Lean Certification or Organizational Development Certification, preferred

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

  • Strategic Planning Models

  • Leadership and Organizational Development, best practices and assessment tools

  • Work process improvement

  • Culture and change management

  • Instructional design, development and delivery

  • Strategic planning and execution through various functions

  • Demonstrated leadership and collaboration through various global operations

  • Dealing with dealer and retail customers

  • Excellent verbal and written communications.

  • Demonstrated facilitation and coaching skills

  • Effective time management and organizational skills

  • Work independently as well as in a team environment

  • Analytical and problem-solving skills

  • Maintain confidentiality

  • Working knowledge of Continuous Improvement, Lean, Six Sigma

  • Handle multiple projects simultaneously within established time constraints

  • Proficient computer skills, including experience with Microsoft Office Suite, internet

  • Perform under strong demands in a fast-paced environment

  • Display empathy, understanding and patience with employees and external customers

  • Respond professionally in situations with difficult employee/vendor/customer issues or inquires

Schedule Expectations:

  • Frequent Domestic and opportunity for International Travel

  • Flexible and willing to work extended hours when necessary to meet the needs of the business

jobs.title: Sales/Business Development Manager (Travel Required)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Are you eager to go on an exciting adventure with a vibrant team and have a strong enthusiasm for travel? Our client, a fast-growing travel and tourism startup, is on the lookout for a vibrant addition to their Travel Advisor Sales Team! As a Sales/Business Development Manager, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of travel by driving sales and forging strong relationships with their Travel Agents.

Your Mission:

  • As a key member of the Sales team, you'll dive headfirst into a dynamic role where no two days are the same. From jet-setting to trade shows and sales calls to nurturing relationships with our valued partners, your adventure starts here!

Key Responsibilities include:

  • Traveling multiple times per month for trade shows / events / sales calls (around 1 week of travel per month and may include weekends). Trips primarily domestic destinations and may include driving, flights, cruise.

  • Growing sales with Consortia agencies yet to work Project Expedition

  • Account Management for advisors and agencies (Weekly Training and point of contact for questions/escalations)

Responsibilities include:

  • Selling to new agencies and advisors through email/phone/in-office visits.

  • Onboarding and training new travel advisors on the product.

  • Account management, marketing (emails/social media), and acting as a point of contact for questions and escalations.

  • Growing advisor and agency account sales.

  • Travel for conferences / sales calls (at least 1 week away per month but could be more subject to business needs). Trips primarily domestic destinations and may include flights, cruise, driving).

The ideal candidate will:

  • Take ownership of tasks related to growing advisor sales.

  • Work effectively across departments within Project Expedition (Support, Accounting, Management).

  • Gather feedback from clients and advocate for product improvements.

  • Possess strong attention to detail.

  • Enjoy problem solving and exceeding client expectations.

  • Work well independently and as part of a team - they are fully remote, but still work closely with colleagues virtually.

  • Excel at multi-tasking and prioritization.

Requirements:

  • Fluent in English (written and spoken).

  • Must maintain a professional appearance and attitude at any business related functions.

  • Valid driver’s license.

  • Happy with flexible work schedule (travel/training may include evenings or early mornings).

Benefits include:

  • Company healthcare plan

  • 401K

  • Quarterly Company Bonus

  • Enrollment in company phantom equity plan

  • 15 days of paid PTO to start (increases to 20 after two years)

  • Work from home budget

  • Company retreats

  • Employee discounts on thousands of tours and activities

Please note that while this is a remote position, it is not suitable for digital nomads. Employees must be based in the United States and will have an allocation of time that they can work remotely in other destinations.


This client is growing very rapidly, and they expect this role will evolve over time. As a result, you will not only have the chance to make a direct impact on a growing company, but you will have the opportunity to shape and influence your career path. This position is great for someone who thrives without a lot of structure, works independently, responds well to change and a fluid working environment, and who always tries to find a better way of doing things.

Vice President of Human Resources

The Vice President of Human Resources will report to the CHRO and serve as a key strategic partner and leader, overseeing HR functions across multiple large business operations. This individual will be a culture champion and operational expert, driving human resources initiatives that support organizational core values and strategic objectives. The VP will lead a team of HR professionals to ensure the effective execution of HR strategies, including employee relations, performance management, and talent development with the goal of fostering a safe, engaged, and highly productive workforce while upholding the organization's commitment to excellence, innovation, and continuous learning.

Core Responsibilities:

Culture & Values Leadership Actively promote and embed organizational core values into all HR practices and employee interactions, serving as a leader who models these values daily. Ensure integration of core values into recruitment, orientation, onboarding, performance management, employee relations, and succession planning processes across all business operations.

Strategic HR Development & Execution:

Work in partnership with business executive leadership to understand all facets of operations and create comprehensive HR plans and talent strategies that support business objectives, emphasizing continuous improvement and operational efficiency. Provide leadership and thought partnership to business leaders, helping develop human capital plans aligned with business strategy. Anticipate market changes, envision future needs, and establish strategic people priorities across operations. Conduct workforce analyses to identify current and future skills needs, aligning HR initiatives with strategic business goals.

Talent Management & Organizational Development:

In partnership with the broader HR organization, lead organizational design efforts to optimize structure and roles for efficiency across all operations. Implement a performance management system that promotes a culture of accountability and continuous feedback through coaching, mentoring, and performance reviews. Coach and mentor leaders to enhance their leadership capabilities. Design and implement succession planning processes to ensure critical roles are adequately staffed and talent identified for future needs.

Employee Relations & Engagement:

Foster engagement and culture by actively promoting safe, inclusive, and high-performing workplaces across all business sites. Reduce turnover and increase retention through programs designed to enhance the workforce. jobs.descriptionHtml:
Let us introduce ourselves. 

livingHR is the remote-first, professional services “work agency” created to make work better. We have served over 400+ organizations to provide human-centric, future-of-work ready, HR-managed services, professional services, and products to augment HR and People functions around the world.  


livingHR believes in taking exceptional care of our team so they can take exceptional care of our clients, partners, and communities. We are adaptable, entrepreneurial, and always looking to iterate and make improvements, which can come with a lot of change (for the better). If you are looking for a role where no day is ever the same, and you prescribe to the idea that variety is the spice of life, then you will likely enjoy our way of working. The people who find the most success here are those who are willing to be a part of a team, where no task is too big or too small, and feedback is welcomed.


To learn more about our Culture Code, Cares Campaign, and our WeBelong work in Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion visit our website: https://livinghr.com/.  


As a full-time team member, we offer you:  

Autonomy & Flexibility: We call it, WfWiMS “Work from Where it Makes Sense,” a philosophy we have had in play since our inception in 2009, and we have no plans to change. This flexibility comes with a responsibility to self-manage and be an exceptional performer. We work remotely and have offices in our hub markets if you want to come in or go onsite with a client and from time to time, we do that too. 

Compensation: Competitive, fair, and transparent base salary plus incentives for account growth, retention, and client referrals. 

Comprehensive Benefits: We provide a wide range of benefits, including medical, dental, 401k, STD/LTD, life, and telehealth mental health counseling.

Flexible PTO/Paid Holidays: We encourage you to use your time, with a minimum requirement, and provide *23 paid holidays. 

A Culture of Impact and Humanity: We care about the impact we make and the humanity we extend to each other, our clients, and our broader community. Learn more about the culture here: https://livinghr.com/culture.  


What You’ll Do

Lead retained and contingent searches for senior leaders (Director to C-suite) in HR and Legal functions

Build trusted, long-term client relationships and serve as a strategic partner during moments of growth and change

Collaborate cross-functionally with our consulting, brand, and talent teams to deliver cohesive, human-centered client experiences

Apply modern practices—including AI-powered sourcing, selection, and assessment tools—to optimize reach, speed,fit, and mitigate bias.

Help shape the future of our executive search methodology and thought leadership


You Bring

7+ years of experience in executive search with a strong focus on HR and/or Legal leadership roles

Experience running your own executive search practice or consultancy—or playing a senior role within one

A deep understanding of how to embed AI and automation to streamline search, improve accuracy, and enhance candidate/client experience

Exceptional relationship-building skills and the ability to influence at the executive and board level

A human-first mindset with a commitment to ethical, inclusive, and business-smart recruiting

A passion for building culture through leadership


What We Offer

A mission-driven company with a strong, respected brand in the HR and People space

A connected team of consultants, creatives, and recruiters who bring heart and strategy to everything we do

Base salary + commission structure (no cap)

A flexible, remote-first work environment

Tools, tech, and support to help you focus on doing what you do best


This Role is Right For You If…

You’ve led high-impact searches, love the art and science of finding the best leader, and are ready to take your work to the next level with a team that shares your drive and energy.

We are not a traditional search firm. We’re building something different. If that gives you energy, we look forward to connecting soon.

  • Strong preference for experience working directly with clients in professional services, PEOs, or recruiting agencies. 

  • Internal HR generalist experience required across multiple disciplines (e.g., talent acquisition, employee relations, total rewards, workforce planning). 

  • Commitment to flexible, high-performance ways of working in exchange for exceptional performance.

  • Exceptional organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple client accounts and projects simultaneously.
